master.commit_message:
Merge pull request #153 from grondo/issue#152

fix compile of slurm plugin against Slurm >= 23.x

ci: test compilation of slurm plugin

Problem: The slurm plugin is not even compiled in Github CI.

Install libslurm-dev to the list of packages to install in the
ci container and add --with-slurm to the list of configure options.

ci: update codecov-action

Problem: Github complains that the codecov-action@v1 is deprecated:

    The following actions uses node12 which is deprecated and will be
    forced to run on node16: codecov/codecov-action@v1.

Update to codecov-action@v3.

ci: update checkout action to v3

Problem: GitHub complains that checkout@v2 is deprecated:

  The following actions uses node12 which is deprecated and will be
  forced to run on node16: actions/checkout@v2.

Update to checkout@v3.

slurm: workaround Slurm 23.x new `list_t` typedef

Problem: Slurm exports a few generic container typedefs via slurm.h
like `List` and `ListIterator` which conflict with pdsh internal
definitions of the same types. To work around this, pdsh currently
defines `__list_datatypes_defined` in the slurm plugin to avoid Slurm
exporting those typedefs. However, in Slurm >23.x, a new typedef
is added, `list_t`, and the list handling functions are updated to
use this new type (which is actually just a new name for the same
type). Now pdsh can no longer use the `__list_datatypes_defined`
because then the necessary `list_t` data is not defined so including
the `slurm.h` header fails. However, without `__list_datatypes_defined`
compilation also fails because the `List` typedef is redefined.

Use the only available option and force the definitions of

 typedef struct xlist list_t;
 typedef struct listIterator list_itr_t;

in the pdsh slurm module before including `slurm.h`. This allows the
`__list_datatypes_defined` define to remain enabled, avoiding the
redefinition of `List` and `ListIterator`, while also ensuring that
the new names for these structs are defined.

This may be brittle in the long term, but is the only solution
available now.

Fixes #152

Merge pull request #144 from jerrymannil/fail-fast

fail fast on connect error or non-zero return code

test: fast-fail update

Add tests that exercise '-k' option

doc: fast-fail update

Add '-k' option for fast-fail

fail fast on ssh errors or non-zero return code

* Added "-k" option to enable fail fast option

* Fail fast on non-zero error code

Fixes #139

Merge pull request #146 from grondo/fwd_signal-macos

sshcmd: fix sshcmd_signal on macos

sshcmd: fix sshcmd_signal on macos

Problem: On Darwin 20.6.0 hosts, sshcmd_signal() fails due to
the err() call which prints "sending SIGTERM to ssh" for an unkown
reason. However, this output is redundant with a similar log message
printed from pipecmd_signal(), so the message is probably useless.

Remove the problematic statement from sshcmd_signal().

Merge pull request #145 from grondo/ci-fixes

ci: fix mergify config and prevent spurious test failures

t0001-basic.sh: do not fail on stderr in test-lib tests

Problem: The "pretend known breakage" and "fixed known breakage"
tests will fail if the test emits anything on stderr. This might cause
unnecessary test failures if some debug is emitted on pdsh stderr.

Remove the test for empty stderr for these tests.

mergify: replace strict merge with queue+rebase

Problem: Mergify.io has deprecated the strict merge mode action:

  https://blog.mergify.io/strict-mode-deprecation/

Replace the strict mode configuration with a default queue with a
rebase action which should be equivalent.

Merge pull request #138 from ycaibb/master

Release a lock that is no longer used

Release a lock that is no longer used in dsh()

In dsh(), the threadcount_mutex is never released. While technically not
 a bug, this could cause a problem or confusion in the future if a lock
is attempted on the mutex. Thus, we fix it by releasing the lock at the
end of dsh().

Signed-off-by: ycaibb <ycaibb@gmail.com>

Merge pull request #130 from orbea/slibtool

build: Use LDADD instead of LDFLAGS for libcommon.la.
build: Use LDADD instead of LDFLAGS for libcommon.la.

Merge pull request #135 from grondo/mergify-update

mergify: fix missing conditions in mergify config

mergify: fix missing conditions in mergify config

Problem: When the mergify config was added to pdsh, important
conditions were left off of the rebase rules.

Add conditions for a required label, reviews, and title to
the mergify config.

Merge pull request #133 from grondo/issue#132

dshbak: fix handling of empty input lines

dshbak: fix uninitialized use of $tag on empty input

Problem: The fix for hostnames of `0` in dshbak, i.e. the
following commit

 commit dee6adf334376da560afa0f8beebe4cae36d8e7c
 Author: Mark A. Grondona <mgrondona@llnl.gov>
 Date:   Thu Jun 25 13:37:51 2015 -0700

    dshbak: Handle hostname of "0"

    @garlick found that dshbak can't handle the smallest of numbers.
    This is because dshbak skips lines where $tag resolves to false.
    But in perl, 0 is also false.

    What we really want to check for is an "empty" tag, so fix up the
    test to reflect that.

    Resolves #70.

breaks handling of empty input to dshbak, since now the variable
"$tag" can be used when it is uninitialized. The proper fix for
issue #70 was to check if the variable was either uninitialized or
an empty string.

Fixes #132

tests: add test for empty dshbak input

Problem: The dshbak tests do not test for empty input to the script,
so a regression that broke the script on empty lines/input was able
to get past make check.

Add a test to ensure that empty input works with dshbak.

Merge pull request #134 from grondo/gh-action

github: add github workflow config for CI

mergify: enable mergify

Add simple mergify config for pdsh

github: add basic github workflow for ci

Problem: No automated ci is established for pdsh.

Add a basic set of ci checks via GitHub Actions.

Include tests on ubuntu and macos, as well as a coverage
report using codecov.io.

cbuf: avoid unused variable errors in production build

Problem: Variables in cbuf.c are used solely for the purpose
of later use in assert(). When built with NDEBUG, this results
in a "set but unused" variable error from GCC.

Fix the error by addition of an _unused(x) macro which tricks
the compiler into thinking the variable is used.

hostlist: fix use of strchr()

Problem: Comparison of strchr() result to NUL results in compiler
warnings.

Test strchr() result against NULL instead to avoid the compiler
warnings.

build: update ax_code_coverage.m4 to latest version

Problem: The ax_code_coverage.m4 macros were out of date and did
not, for example, support recent versions of lcov.

Update to a later version to get recent fixes.

travis-ci: remove travis-related files

Problem: Travis-CI is no longer a viable CI host for open source
projects.

Remove the travis yaml file and scripts/travis-ci-deps.sh which are
no longer needed.

Merge pull request #129 from jrstjohn/fix-spec-file-missing

Remove README.QsNet from the RPM SPEC file's doc list

Remove README.QsNet from the RPM SPEC file's doc list

This file doesn't exist and causes rpmbuild to fail when the file can't be
found

Merge pull request #126 from dylex/master

slurm: add -C to restrict hostlist to nodes with specified features
slurm: vacuous -C test
slurm: add documentation for -C

slurm: add -C features constraint

Restrict existing hostlist to nodes with one of the given features (like
srun -C)
